  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced(char action) throws exceptions.DivisionByZeroException, exceptions.NotSupportedOperationException, exceptions.NumberNotInAreaException
      Method for advanced calculations. If parameter action is digit from 0 to 9 this method should set currentValue to power of rounded currentValue and degree should be that digit. If parameter action is ! this method should set currentValue to factorial of currentValue.
      Parameters:
      action - - the action to perform, can be a digit from 0 to 9 or the character '!'
      Throws:
      exceptions.DivisionByZeroException - if the value of currentValue is 0 and action is '/'
      exceptions.NotSupportedOperationException - if the value of action is not a digit from 0 to 9 or '!'
      exceptions.NumberNotInAreaException - if currentValue is not in the range of [0, 10] when action is '!'

    • factorial

    • hasCharacteristic

      public Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value) throws exceptions.NumberNotInAreaException, exceptions.NotSupportedOperationException
      This method checks if currentValue is Armstrong number or perfect number and returns true, otherwise it returns false. Method accepts @param value and it can be 'A' to check Armstrong number or 'P' to check if it is perfect number.
      Parameters:
      value -
      Returns:
      Boolean
      Throws:
      exceptions.NumberNotInAreaException - is thrown if currentValue integer is less than 1
      exceptions.NotSupportedOperationException - if @param value is not 'A' or 'P'

    • roundNumber

      public Double roundNumber()
      This method rounds currentValue to integer part of currentValue. For example if currentValue is 4.56 this method will return 4.0.
      Returns:
      Double
